        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      This bug is split off from <span class="line"><!---->This bug is split off from <!----></span>Issue 1260109<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260109" title="Security: [Umbrella Bug] V8 CreateLiteral type confusion when processing ..spread leads to RCE + RenderFrameHostImpl logic error leading browser UAF"><!---->Issue 1260109<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>to track the RenderFrameHostImpl bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. Note that this may be similar to <span class="line"><!---->to track the RenderFrameHostImpl bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. Note that this may be similar to <!----></span>Issue 1260007<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260007" title="Security: State tracking issue in RenderFrameHostImpl leading to UaF"><!---->Issue 1260007<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>--------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------<!----></span><br><br>= SBX: Logic error in RFHI leads to UAF<span class="line"><!---->= SBX: Logic error in RFHI leads to UAF<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></span><br>When an embedded MimeHandlerView or a Portal is created, they create an Outer and Inner WebContents with RenderFrames and RenderFrameHostImpl. The outer RenderFrameHostImpl will exist in the RenderFrame that created it. <span class="line"><!---->When an embedded MimeHandlerView or a Portal is created, they create an Outer and Inner WebContents with RenderFrames and RenderFrameHostImpl. The outer RenderFrameHostImpl will exist in the RenderFrame that created it. <!----></span><br><br>When the outer delegate receives an OnUnloadAck IPC it will reach this branch [1]<span class="line"><!---->When the outer delegate receives an OnUnloadAck IPC it will reach this branch [1]<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br> if (frame_tree_node_->render_manager()->is_attaching_inner_delegate()) {<span class="line"><!----> if (frame_tree_node_-&gt;render_manager()-&gt;is_attaching_inner_delegate()) {<!----></span><br>    RenderFrameDeleted();<span class="line"><!---->    RenderFrameDeleted();<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Which will call the WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted observer and set the RenderFrameHost's state to `RenderFrameState::kDeleting` [2]. This will cause the RenderFrameHostImpl::~RenderFrameHostImpl destructor to not fire the `RenderFrameDeleted` observer [3]. Mojo connections were are not cleared when RenderFrameDeleted is called, meaning this frame can still bind and call Mojo IPC. Opening up UAFs on every Mojo ipc object that is protected by RendererFrameDeleted [4]. For example,<span class="line"><!---->Which will call the WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted observer and set the RenderFrameHost's state to `RenderFrameState::kDeleting` [2]. This will cause the RenderFrameHostImpl::~RenderFrameHostImpl destructor to not fire the `RenderFrameDeleted` observer [3]. Mojo connections were are not cleared when RenderFrameDeleted is called, meaning this frame can still bind and call Mojo IPC. Opening up UAFs on every Mojo ipc object that is protected by RendererFrameDeleted [4]. For example,<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void InstalledAppProviderImpl::RenderFrameDeleted(<span class="line"><!---->void InstalledAppProviderImpl::RenderFrameDeleted(<!----></span><br>    RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->    RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>  if (render_frame_host_ == render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (render_frame_host_ == render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void FileSelectHelper::RenderFrameDeleted(<span class="line"><!---->void FileSelectHelper::RenderFrameDeleted(<!----></span><br>    content::RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->    content::RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>  if (render_frame_host == render_frame_host_)<span class="line"><!---->  if (render_frame_host == render_frame_host_)<!----></span><br>    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Potentially another bug: I believe that on the browser-side Portals (not renderer side) were accidentally left enabled last Novemeber after the M86 origin trial [5]. Meaning this also affects portals. If this is true (still verifying), I think this should be considered a second High severity bug as it opens up the entire portal attack surface to android.<span class="line"><!---->Potentially another bug: I believe that on the browser-side Portals (not renderer side) were accidentally left enabled last Novemeber after the M86 origin trial [5]. Meaning this also affects portals. If this is true (still verifying), I think this should be considered a second High severity bug as it opens up the entire portal attack surface to android.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span           Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1260134#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      btiszka@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/3118852115" title="btiszka@gmail.com"><!---->btiszka@gmail.com<!----></a>
      btiszka@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->btiszka@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Fri, Oct 15, 2021, 12:55 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Oct 15, 2021, 12:55 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1260134#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Oct 15, 2021, 12:55 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1260134#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Oct 15, 2021, 12:55 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        A little more explanation on the renderer patch:<span class="line"><!---->A little more explanation on the renderer patch:<!----></span><br><br>`RenderFrameImpl::Unload` will only be called with `is_loading` set to `false` if the SwapOuterDelegateFrame is called [1], which is the case for these outer webcontent delegate frames.<span class="line"><!---->`RenderFrameImpl::Unload` will only be called with `is_loading` set to `false` if the SwapOuterDelegateFrame is called [1], which is the case for these outer webcontent delegate frames.<!----></span><br><br>The patch overwrites `RenderFrameImpl::Unload` and prevents the renderer from unloading the RenderFrameImpl in the renderer. Then it sends an OnUnloadAck to the browser to trigger `RenderFrameDeleted`. Then it executes it's own malicious javascript to bind a FileChooser which holds the render_frame_host_ that is no longer in the Created state [2].<span class="line"><!---->The patch overwrites `RenderFrameImpl::Unload` and prevents the renderer from unloading the RenderFrameImpl in the renderer. Then it sends an OnUnloadAck to the browser to trigger `RenderFrameDeleted`. Then it executes it's own malicious javascript to bind a FileChooser which holds the render_frame_host_ that is no longer in the Created state [2].<!----></span><br><br>From there in index.html, we intercept the Mojo handle created by the renderer patch I explained above, free the render_frame_host_ (which never triggers RenderFrameDeleted), and call EnumerateChosenDirectory which uses the freed render_frame_host_ because it was never nulled out in RenderFrameDeleted.<span class="line"><!---->From there in index.html, we intercept the Mojo handle created by the renderer patch I explained above, free the render_frame_host_ (which never triggers RenderFrameDeleted), and call EnumerateChosenDirectory which uses the freed render_frame_host_ because it was never nulled out in RenderFrameDeleted.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36<!----></a><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=1529;drc=260ee0a4e02100f735284b1abc89761d69d059ba<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=1529;drc=260ee0a4e02100f735284b1abc89761d69d059ba"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=1529;drc=260ee0a4e02100f735284b1abc89761d69d059ba<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Yup that's the issue. My poc was using a Mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker and not the AssociatedRegistry (which is invalidated by `InvalidateMojoConnection()`. So, `broker_receiver_.reset()` after `InvalidateMojoConnection()` to prevent the poc in this issue (and any other mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker that relies on RenderFrameDeleted)<span class="line"><!---->Yup that's the issue. My poc was using a Mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker and not the AssociatedRegistry (which is invalidated by `InvalidateMojoConnection()`. So, `broker_receiver_.reset()` after `InvalidateMojoConnection()` to prevent the poc in this issue (and any other mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker that relies on RenderFrameDeleted)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        I also wanted to add that this statement also ended up being true:<span class="line"><!---->I also wanted to add that this statement also ended up being true:<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Potentially another bug: I believe that on the browser-side Portals (not renderer side) were accidentally left enabled last Novemeber after the M86 origin trial [5]. Meaning this also affects portals. If this is true (still verifying), I think this should be considered a second High severity bug as it opens up the entire portal attack surface to android.<span class="line"><!---->Potentially another bug: I believe that on the browser-side Portals (not renderer side) were accidentally left enabled last Novemeber after the M86 origin trial [5]. Meaning this also affects portals. If this is true (still verifying), I think this should be considered a second High severity bug as it opens up the entire portal attack surface to android.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>and was fixed in <span class="line"><!---->and was fixed in <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3227062<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3227062"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3227062<!----></a> shortly after. It also inspired the discovery of a similar bug in FencedFrames - <span class="line"><!----> shortly after. It also inspired the discovery of a similar bug in FencedFrames - <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1270358<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1270358"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1270358<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> For people like me who are interested in code archaeology (bug etymology?), it sounds like 1270358 was introduced because kPortal's feature flag implementation was being used as example code while it was left enabled. I did a quick audit and only found the kFencedFrames bug, but it seems like a pattern that could potentially pop up again in the future.<span class="line"><!----> For people like me who are interested in code archaeology (bug etymology?), it sounds like 1270358 was introduced because kPortal's feature flag implementation was being used as example code while it was left enabled. I did a quick audit and only found the kFencedFrames bug, but it seems like a pattern that could potentially pop up again in the future.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Brendon! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $20,000 for this report. We appreciate all your efforts from the submission of your full chain report, your through analysis in working with the Chrome Security team. <span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Brendon! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $20,000 for this report. We appreciate all your efforts from the submission of your full chain report, your through analysis in working with the Chrome Security team. <!----></span><br>You'll share the credit with Sergei Glazunov of Project Zero as his report was reported just narrowly (four hours!) before yours, but we wanted to bonus you for this high quality report and all your efforts following reporting this issue to us. Cheers!<span class="line"><!---->You'll share the credit with Sergei Glazunov of Project Zero as his report was reported just narrowly (four hours!) before yours, but we wanted to bonus you for this high quality report and all your efforts following reporting this issue to us. Cheers!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        Convert issue to new template structure<h3 class="medium-heading">Convert issue to new template structure</h3>
        
          
            Pick a template: <label for="templateInput">Pick a template: </label>
            
              --Please choose a project template--<option value="">--Please choose a project template--</option>
              
                
                   Vpython Wheel Request
                <option value=" Vpython Wheel Request">
                   Vpython Wheel Request
                </option>
                
                  (test)(new) postmortem tracking bug
                <option value="(test)(new) postmortem tracking bug">
                  (test)(new) postmortem tracking bug
                </option>
                
                  Android Issue

                  Android Issue
                </option>

                <option value="Audio/Video Communication Bugs">

                </option>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

          min-width: 256px;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

    line-height: 1.6;
  }

    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

    text-decoration: underline;

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          
            Close
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>

                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      This bug is split off from <span class="line"><!---->This bug is split off from <!----></span>Issue 1260109<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260109" title="Security: [Umbrella Bug] V8 CreateLiteral type confusion when processing ..spread leads to RCE + RenderFrameHostImpl logic error leading browser UAF"><!---->Issue 1260109<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>to track the RenderFrameHostImpl bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. Note that this may be similar to <span class="line"><!---->to track the RenderFrameHostImpl bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. Note that this may be similar to <!----></span>Issue 1260007<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260007" title="Security: State tracking issue in RenderFrameHostImpl leading to UaF"><!---->Issue 1260007<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>--------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------<!----></span><br><br>= SBX: Logic error in RFHI leads to UAF<span class="line"><!---->= SBX: Logic error in RFHI leads to UAF<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></span><br>When an embedded MimeHandlerView or a Portal is created, they create an Outer and Inner WebContents with RenderFrames and RenderFrameHostImpl. The outer RenderFrameHostImpl will exist in the RenderFrame that created it. <span class="line"><!---->When an embedded MimeHandlerView or a Portal is created, they create an Outer and Inner WebContents with RenderFrames and RenderFrameHostImpl. The outer RenderFrameHostImpl will exist in the RenderFrame that created it. <!----></span><br><br>When the outer delegate receives an OnUnloadAck IPC it will reach this branch [1]<span class="line"><!---->When the outer delegate receives an OnUnloadAck IPC it will reach this branch [1]<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br> if (frame_tree_node_->render_manager()->is_attaching_inner_delegate()) {<span class="line"><!----> if (frame_tree_node_-&gt;render_manager()-&gt;is_attaching_inner_delegate()) {<!----></span><br>    RenderFrameDeleted();<span class="line"><!---->    RenderFrameDeleted();<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Which will call the WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted observer and set the RenderFrameHost's state to `RenderFrameState::kDeleting` [2]. This will cause the RenderFrameHostImpl::~RenderFrameHostImpl destructor to not fire the `RenderFrameDeleted` observer [3]. Mojo connections were are not cleared when RenderFrameDeleted is called, meaning this frame can still bind and call Mojo IPC. Opening up UAFs on every Mojo ipc object that is protected by RendererFrameDeleted [4]. For example,<span class="line"><!---->Which will call the WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted observer and set the RenderFrameHost's state to `RenderFrameState::kDeleting` [2]. This will cause the RenderFrameHostImpl::~RenderFrameHostImpl destructor to not fire the `RenderFrameDeleted` observer [3]. Mojo connections were are not cleared when RenderFrameDeleted is called, meaning this frame can still bind and call Mojo IPC. Opening up UAFs on every Mojo ipc object that is protected by RendererFrameDeleted [4]. Meaning this also affects portals.         A little more explanation on the renderer patch:<span class="line"><!---->A little more explanation on the renderer patch:<!----></span><br><br>`RenderFrameImpl::Unload` will only be called with `is_loading` set to `false` if the SwapOuterDelegateFrame is called [1], which is the case for these outer webcontent delegate frames.<span class="line"><!---->`RenderFrameImpl::Unload` will only be called with `is_loading` set to `false` if the SwapOuterDelegateFrame is called [1], which is the case for these outer webcontent delegate frames.<!----></span><br><br>The patch overwrites `RenderFrameImpl::Unload` and prevents the renderer from unloading the RenderFrameImpl in the renderer. Then it sends an OnUnloadAck to the browser to trigger `RenderFrameDeleted`. Then it executes it's own malicious javascript to bind a FileChooser which holds the render_frame_host_ that is no longer in the Created state [2].<span class="line"><!---->The patch overwrites `RenderFrameImpl::Unload` and prevents the renderer from unloading the RenderFrameImpl in the renderer. Then it sends an OnUnloadAck to the browser to trigger `RenderFrameDeleted`. Then it executes it's own malicious javascript to bind a FileChooser which holds the render_frame_host_ that is no longer in the Created state [2].<!----></span><br><br>From there in index.html, we intercept the Mojo handle created by the renderer patch I explained above, free the render_frame_host_ (which never triggers RenderFrameDeleted), and call EnumerateChosenDirectory which uses the freed render_frame_host_ because it was never nulled out in RenderFrameDeleted.<span class="line"><!---->From there in index.html, we intercept the Mojo handle created by the renderer patch I explained above, free the render_frame_host_ (which never triggers RenderFrameDeleted), and call EnumerateChosenDirectory which uses the freed render_frame_host_ because it was never nulled out in RenderFrameDeleted.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36<!----></a><br>[3]         Yup that's the issue. My poc was using a Mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker and not the AssociatedRegistry (which is invalidated by `InvalidateMojoConnection()`. So, `broker_receiver_.reset()` after `InvalidateMojoConnection()` to prevent the poc in this issue (and any other mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker that relies on RenderFrameDeleted)<span class="line"><!---->Yup that's the issue. My poc was using a Mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker and not the AssociatedRegistry (which is invalidated by `InvalidateMojoConnection()`. So, `broker_receiver_.reset()` after `InvalidateMojoConnection()` to prevent the poc in this issue (and any other mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker that relies on RenderFrameDeleted)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

&lt;<!----></span>dcheng@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dcheng@chromium.org"><!---->dcheng@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Sat additional fields that hold Mojo endpoints to the renderer.<span class="line"><!---->resets a few additional fields that hold Mojo endpoints to the renderer.<!----></span><br><br>Original change's         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;

          white-space: nowrap;
        }

          overflow: hidden;

      </style>

      </div>
    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

          </tbody>
        </table>

      <chops-dialog closeonoutsideclick="">
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>
          <button aria-label="close">

          </button>

      </chops-dialog>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      </button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      This bug is split off from <span class="line"><!---->This bug is split off from <!----></span>Issue 1260109<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260109" title="Security: [Umbrella Bug] V8 CreateLiteral type confusion when processing ..spread leads to RCE + RenderFrameHostImpl logic error leading browser UAF"><!---->Issue 1260109<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>to track the RenderFrameHostImpl bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. Note that this may be similar to <span class="line"><!---->to track the RenderFrameHostImpl bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. Note that this may be similar to <!----></span>Issue 1260007<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260007" title="Security: State tracking issue in RenderFrameHostImpl leading to UaF"><!---->Issue 1260007<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>--------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------<!----></span><br><br>= SBX: Logic error in RFHI leads to UAF<span class="line"><!---->= SBX: Logic error in RFHI leads to UAF<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></span><br>When an embedded MimeHandlerView or a Portal is created, they create an Outer and Inner WebContents with RenderFrames and RenderFrameHostImpl. The outer RenderFrameHostImpl will exist in the RenderFrame that created it. <span class="line"><!---->When an embedded MimeHandlerView or a Portal is created, they create an Outer and Inner WebContents with RenderFrames and RenderFrameHostImpl. The outer RenderFrameHostImpl will exist in the RenderFrame that created it. <!----></span><br><br>When the outer delegate receives an OnUnloadAck IPC it will reach this branch [1]<span class="line"><!---->When the outer delegate receives an OnUnloadAck IPC it will reach this branch [1]<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br> if (frame_tree_node_->render_manager()->is_attaching_inner_delegate()) {<span class="line"><!----> if (frame_tree_node_-&gt;render_manager()-&gt;is_attaching_inner_delegate()) {<!----></span><br>    RenderFrameDeleted();<span class="line"><!---->    RenderFrameDeleted();<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Which will call the WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted observer and set the RenderFrameHost's state to `RenderFrameState::kDeleting` [2]. This will cause the RenderFrameHostImpl::~RenderFrameHostImpl destructor to not fire the `RenderFrameDeleted` observer [3]. Mojo connections were are not cleared when RenderFrameDeleted is called, meaning this frame can still bind and call Mojo IPC. Opening up UAFs on every Mojo ipc object that is protected by RendererFrameDeleted [4]. For example,<span class="line"><!---->Which will call the WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted observer and set the RenderFrameHost's state to `RenderFrameState::kDeleting` [2]. This will cause the RenderFrameHostImpl::~RenderFrameHostImpl destructor to not fire the `RenderFrameDeleted` observer [3]. Mojo connections were are not cleared when RenderFrameDeleted is called, meaning this frame can still bind and call Mojo IPC. Opening up UAFs on every Mojo ipc object that is protected by RendererFrameDeleted [4]. For example,<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void InstalledAppProviderImpl::RenderFrameDeleted(<span class="line"><!---->void InstalledAppProviderImpl::RenderFrameDeleted(<!----></span><br>    RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->    RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>  if (render_frame_host_ == render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (render_frame_host_ == render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void FileSelectHelper::RenderFrameDeleted(<span class="line"><!---->void FileSelectHelper::RenderFrameDeleted(<!----></span><br>    content::RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->    content::RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>  if (render_frame_host == render_frame_host_)<span class="line"><!---->  if (render_frame_host == render_frame_host_)<!----></span><br>    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Potentially another bug: I believe that on the browser-side Portals (not renderer side) were accidentally left enabled last Novemeber after the M86 origin trial [5]. Meaning this also affects portals. If this is true (still verifying), I think this should be considered a second High severity bug as it opens up the entire portal attack surface to android.<span class="line"><!---->Potentially another bug: I believe that on the browser-side Portals (not renderer side) were accidentally left enabled last Novemeber after the M86 origin trial [5]. Meaning this also affects portals. If this is true (still verifying), I think this should be considered a second High severity bug as it opens up the entire portal attack surface to android.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span         by

        A little more explanation on the renderer patch:<span class="line"><!---->A little more explanation on the renderer patch:<!----></span><br><br>`RenderFrameImpl::Unload` will only be called with `is_loading` set to `false` if the SwapOuterDelegateFrame is called [1], which is the case for these outer webcontent delegate frames.<span class="line"><!---->`RenderFrameImpl::Unload` will only be called with `is_loading` set to `false` if the SwapOuterDelegateFrame is called [1], which is the case for these outer webcontent delegate frames.<!----></span><br><br>The patch overwrites `RenderFrameImpl::Unload` and prevents the renderer from unloading the RenderFrameImpl in the renderer. Then it sends an OnUnloadAck to the browser to trigger `RenderFrameDeleted`. Then it executes it's own malicious javascript to bind a FileChooser which holds the render_frame_host_ that is no longer in the Created state [2].<span class="line"><!---->The patch overwrites `RenderFrameImpl::Unload` and prevents the renderer from unloading the RenderFrameImpl in the renderer. Then it sends an OnUnloadAck to the browser to trigger `RenderFrameDeleted`. Then it executes it's own malicious javascript to bind a FileChooser which holds the render_frame_host_ that is no longer in the Created state [2].<!----></span><br><br>From there in index.html, we intercept the Mojo handle created by the renderer patch I explained above, free the render_frame_host_ (which never triggers RenderFrameDeleted), and call EnumerateChosenDirectory which uses the freed render_frame_host_ because it was never nulled out in RenderFrameDeleted.<span class="line"><!---->From there in index.html, we intercept the Mojo handle created by the renderer patch I explained above, free the render_frame_host_ (which never triggers RenderFrameDeleted), and call EnumerateChosenDirectory which uses the freed render_frame_host_ because it was never nulled out in RenderFrameDeleted.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36<!----></a><br>[3]         Yup that's the issue. My poc was using a Mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker and not the AssociatedRegistry (which is invalidated by `InvalidateMojoConnection()`. So, `broker_receiver_.reset()` after `InvalidateMojoConnection()` to prevent the poc in this issue (and any other mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker that relies on RenderFrameDeleted)<span class="line"><!---->Yup that's the issue. My poc was using a Mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker and not the AssociatedRegistry (which is invalidated by `InvalidateMojoConnection()`. So, `broker_receiver_.reset()` after `InvalidateMojoConnection()` to prevent the poc in this issue (and any other mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker that relies on RenderFrameDeleted)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>
