              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      This bug is split off from <span class="line"><!---->This bug is split off from <!----></span>Issue 1260109<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260109" title="Security: [Umbrella Bug] V8 CreateLiteral type confusion when processing ..spread leads to RCE + RenderFrameHostImpl logic error leading browser UAF"><!---->Issue 1260109<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>to track the RenderFrameHostImpl bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. Note that this may be similar to <span class="line"><!---->to track the RenderFrameHostImpl bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. Note that this may be similar to <!----></span>Issue 1260007<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260007" title="Security: State tracking issue in RenderFrameHostImpl leading to UaF"><!---->Issue 1260007<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>--------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------<!----></span><br><br>= SBX: Logic error in RFHI leads to UAF<span class="line"><!---->= SBX: Logic error in RFHI leads to UAF<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></span><br>When an embedded MimeHandlerView or a Portal is created, they create an Outer and Inner WebContents with RenderFrames and RenderFrameHostImpl. The outer RenderFrameHostImpl will exist in the RenderFrame that created it. <span class="line"><!---->When an embedded MimeHandlerView or a Portal is created, they create an Outer and Inner WebContents with RenderFrames and RenderFrameHostImpl. The outer RenderFrameHostImpl will exist in the RenderFrame that created it. <!----></span><br><br>When the outer delegate receives an OnUnloadAck IPC it will reach this branch [1]<span class="line"><!---->When the outer delegate receives an OnUnloadAck IPC it will reach this branch [1]<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br> if (frame_tree_node_->render_manager()->is_attaching_inner_delegate()) {<span class="line"><!----> if (frame_tree_node_-&gt;render_manager()-&gt;is_attaching_inner_delegate()) {<!----></span><br>    RenderFrameDeleted();<span class="line"><!---->    RenderFrameDeleted();<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Which will call the WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted observer and set the RenderFrameHost's state to `RenderFrameState::kDeleting` [2]. This will cause the RenderFrameHostImpl::~RenderFrameHostImpl destructor to not fire the `RenderFrameDeleted` observer [3]. Mojo connections were are not cleared when RenderFrameDeleted is called, meaning this frame can still bind and call Mojo IPC. Opening up UAFs on every Mojo ipc object that is protected by RendererFrameDeleted [4]. For example,<span class="line"><!---->Which will call the WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted observer and set the RenderFrameHost's state to `RenderFrameState::kDeleting` [2]. This will cause the RenderFrameHostImpl::~RenderFrameHostImpl destructor to not fire the `RenderFrameDeleted` observer [3]. Mojo connections were are not cleared when RenderFrameDeleted is called, meaning this frame can still bind and call Mojo IPC. Opening up UAFs on every Mojo ipc object that is protected by RendererFrameDeleted [4]. For example,<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void InstalledAppProviderImpl::RenderFrameDeleted(<span class="line"><!---->void InstalledAppProviderImpl::RenderFrameDeleted(<!----></span><br>    RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->    RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>  if (render_frame_host_ == render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (render_frame_host_ == render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void FileSelectHelper::RenderFrameDeleted(<span class="line"><!---->void FileSelectHelper::RenderFrameDeleted(<!----></span><br>    content::RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->    content::RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>  if (render_frame_host == render_frame_host_)<span class="line"><!---->  if (render_frame_host == render_frame_host_)<!----></span><br>    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Potentially another bug: I believe that on the browser-side Portals (not renderer side) were accidentally left enabled last Novemeber after the M86 origin trial [5]. Meaning this also affects portals. If this is true (still verifying), I think this should be considered a second High severity bug as it opens up the entire portal attack surface to android.<span class="line"><!---->Potentially another bug: I believe that on the browser-side Portals (not renderer side) were accidentally left enabled last Novemeber after the M86 origin trial [5]. Meaning this also affects portals. If this is true (still verifying), I think this should be considered a second High severity bug as it opens up the entire portal attack surface to android.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span         by

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Oct 15, 2021, 12:55 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1260134#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Oct 15, 2021, 12:55 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        A little more explanation on the renderer patch:<span class="line"><!---->A little more explanation on the renderer patch:<!----></span><br><br>`RenderFrameImpl::Unload` will only be called with `is_loading` set to `false` if the SwapOuterDelegateFrame is called [1], which is the case for these outer webcontent delegate frames.<span class="line"><!---->`RenderFrameImpl::Unload` will only be called with `is_loading` set to `false` if the SwapOuterDelegateFrame is called [1], which is the case for these outer webcontent delegate frames.<!----></span><br><br>The patch overwrites `RenderFrameImpl::Unload` and prevents the renderer from unloading the RenderFrameImpl in the renderer. Then it sends an OnUnloadAck to the browser to trigger `RenderFrameDeleted`. Then it executes it's own malicious javascript to bind a FileChooser which holds the render_frame_host_ that is no longer in the Created state [2].<span class="line"><!---->The patch overwrites `RenderFrameImpl::Unload` and prevents the renderer from unloading the RenderFrameImpl in the renderer. Then it sends an OnUnloadAck to the browser to trigger `RenderFrameDeleted`. Then it executes it's own malicious javascript to bind a FileChooser which holds the render_frame_host_ that is no longer in the Created state [2].<!----></span><br><br>From there in index.html, we intercept the Mojo handle created by the renderer patch I explained above, free the render_frame_host_ (which never triggers RenderFrameDeleted), and call EnumerateChosenDirectory which uses the freed render_frame_host_ because it was never nulled out in RenderFrameDeleted.<span class="line"><!---->From there in index.html, we intercept the Mojo handle created by the renderer patch I explained above, free the render_frame_host_ (which never triggers RenderFrameDeleted), and call EnumerateChosenDirectory which uses the freed render_frame_host_ because it was never nulled out in RenderFrameDeleted.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36<!----></a><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=1529;drc=260ee0a4e02100f735284b1abc89761d69d059ba<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=1529;drc=260ee0a4e02100f735284b1abc89761d69d059ba"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=1529;drc=260ee0a4e02100f735284b1abc89761d69d059ba<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Yup that's the issue. My poc was using a Mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker and not the AssociatedRegistry (which is invalidated by `InvalidateMojoConnection()`. So, `broker_receiver_.reset()` after `InvalidateMojoConnection()` to prevent the poc in this issue (and any other mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker that relies on RenderFrameDeleted)<span class="line"><!---->Yup that's the issue. My poc was using a Mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker and not the AssociatedRegistry (which is invalidated by `InvalidateMojoConnection()`. So, `broker_receiver_.reset()` after `InvalidateMojoConnection()` to prevent the poc in this issue (and any other mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker that relies on RenderFrameDeleted)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        dcheng: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->dcheng: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<span class="line"><!---->If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<!----></span><br><br>Thanks for your time!         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Brendon! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $20,000 for this report. We appreciate all your efforts from the submission of your full chain report, your through analysis in working with the Chrome Security team. <span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Brendon! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $20,000 for this report. We appreciate all your efforts from the submission of your full chain report, your through analysis in working with the Chrome Security team. <!----></span><br>You'll share the credit with Sergei Glazunov of Project Zero as his report was reported just narrowly (four hours!) before yours, but we wanted to bonus you for this high quality report and all your efforts following reporting this issue to us.       This bug is split off from <span class="line"><!---->This bug is split off from <!----></span>Issue 1260109<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260109" title="Security: [Umbrella Bug] V8 CreateLiteral type confusion when processing ..spread leads to RCE + RenderFrameHostImpl logic error leading browser UAF"><!---->Issue 1260109<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>to track the RenderFrameHostImpl bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. Note that this may be similar to <span class="line"><!---->to track the RenderFrameHostImpl bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. Note that this may be similar to <!----></span>Issue 1260007<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260007" title="Security: State tracking issue in RenderFrameHostImpl leading to UaF"><!---->Issue 1260007<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>--------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------<!----></span><br><br>= SBX: Logic error in RFHI leads to UAF<span class="line"><!---->= SBX: Logic error in RFHI leads to UAF<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></span><br>When an embedded MimeHandlerView or a Portal is created, they create an Outer and Inner WebContents with RenderFrames and RenderFrameHostImpl. The outer RenderFrameHostImpl will exist in the RenderFrame that created it. <span class="line"><!---->When an embedded MimeHandlerView or a Portal is created, they create an Outer and Inner WebContents with RenderFrames and RenderFrameHostImpl. The outer RenderFrameHostImpl will exist in the RenderFrame that created it. <!----></span><br><br>When the outer delegate receives an OnUnloadAck IPC it will reach this branch [1]<span class="line"><!---->When the outer delegate receives an OnUnloadAck IPC it will reach this branch [1]<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br> if (frame_tree_node_->render_manager()->is_attaching_inner_delegate()) {<span class="line"><!----> if (frame_tree_node_-&gt;render_manager()-&gt;is_attaching_inner_delegate()) {<!----></span><br>    RenderFrameDeleted();<span class="line"><!---->    RenderFrameDeleted();<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Which will call the WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted observer and set the RenderFrameHost's state to `RenderFrameState::kDeleting` [2]. This will cause the RenderFrameHostImpl::~RenderFrameHostImpl destructor to not fire the `RenderFrameDeleted` observer [3]. Mojo connections were are not cleared when RenderFrameDeleted is called, meaning this frame can still bind and call Mojo IPC. Opening up UAFs on every Mojo ipc object that is protected by RendererFrameDeleted [4]. For example,<span class="line"><!---->Which will call the WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted observer and set the RenderFrameHost's state to `RenderFrameState::kDeleting` [2]. This will cause the RenderFrameHostImpl::~RenderFrameHostImpl destructor to not fire the `RenderFrameDeleted` observer [3]. Mojo connections were are not cleared when RenderFrameDeleted is called, meaning this frame can still bind and call Mojo IPC. Opening up UAFs on every Mojo ipc object that is protected by RendererFrameDeleted [4]. For example,<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void InstalledAppProviderImpl::RenderFrameDeleted(<span class="line"><!---->void InstalledAppProviderImpl::RenderFrameDeleted(<!----></span><br>    RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->    RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>  if (render_frame_host_ == render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (render_frame_host_ == render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void FileSelectHelper::RenderFrameDeleted(<span class="line"><!---->void FileSelectHelper::RenderFrameDeleted(<!----></span><br>    content::RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->    content::RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>  if (render_frame_host == render_frame_host_)<span class="line"><!---->  if (render_frame_host == render_frame_host_)<!----></span><br>    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Potentially another bug: I believe that on the browser-side Portals (not renderer side) were accidentally left enabled last Novemeber after the M86 origin trial [5]. Meaning this also affects portals. If this is true (still verifying), I think this should be considered a second High severity bug as it opens up the entire portal attack surface to android.<span class="line"><!---->Potentially another bug: I believe that on the browser-side Portals (not renderer side) were accidentally left enabled last Novemeber after the M86 origin trial [5]. Meaning this also affects portals. If this is true (still verifying), I think this should be considered a second High severity bug as it opens up the entire portal attack surface to android.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span EXPLOITATION DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->II. EXPLOITATION DETAILS<!----></span><br>#todo<span class="line"><!---->#todo<!----></span><br><br>III. REPRODUCTION DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->III. REPRODUCTION DETAILS<!----></span><br>1. Apply the renderer process patch in 18_embedder_rfhi_intercept/hack_patch.diff to 94.0.4606.81 (git reset --hard 94.0.4606.81 && gclient sync)<span class="line"><!---->1. Apply the renderer process patch in 18_embedder_rfhi_intercept/hack_patch.diff to 94.0.4606.81 (git reset --hard 94.0.4606.81 &amp;&amp; gclient sync)<!----></span><br>1a. (run copy_mojo_bindings.py /path/to/chromium/out/ mojo if the offsets I provided don't work for whatever reason)<span class="line"><!---->1a. (run copy_mojo_bindings.py /path/to/chromium/out/ mojo if the offsets I provided don't work for whatever reason)<!----></span><br>2. Run the caddy server <span class="line"><!---->2. Run the caddy server <!----></span><br>3. ASAN_OPTIONS=detect_odr_violation=0 ./out/x64.asan/chrome --ignore-certificate-errors --disable-gpu --enable-blink-features=MojoJS,MojoJSTest <span class="line"><!---->3.           Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1260134#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      btiszka@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/3118852115" title="btiszka@gmail.com"><!---->btiszka@gmail.com<!----></a>
      btiszka@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->btiszka@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Fri, Oct 15, 2021, 12:55 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Oct 15, 2021, 12:55 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1260134#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Oct 15, 2021, 12:55 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1260134#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Oct 15, 2021, 12:55 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        A little more explanation on the renderer patch:<span class="line"><!---->A little more explanation on the renderer patch:<!----></span><br><br>`RenderFrameImpl::Unload` will only be called with `is_loading` set to `false` if the SwapOuterDelegateFrame is called [1], which is the case for these outer webcontent delegate frames.<span class="line"><!---->`RenderFrameImpl::Unload` will only be called with `is_loading` set to `false` if the SwapOuterDelegateFrame is called [1], which is the case for these outer webcontent delegate frames.<!----></span><br><br>The patch overwrites `RenderFrameImpl::Unload` and prevents the renderer from unloading the RenderFrameImpl in the renderer. Then it sends an OnUnloadAck to the browser to trigger `RenderFrameDeleted`. Then it executes it's own malicious javascript to bind a FileChooser which holds the render_frame_host_ that is no longer in the Created state [2].<span class="line"><!---->The patch overwrites `RenderFrameImpl::Unload` and prevents the renderer from unloading the RenderFrameImpl in the renderer. Then it sends an OnUnloadAck to the browser to trigger `RenderFrameDeleted`. Then it executes it's own malicious javascript to bind a FileChooser which holds the render_frame_host_ that is no longer in the Created state [2].<!----></span><br><br>From there in index.html, we intercept the Mojo handle created by the renderer patch I explained above, free the render_frame_host_ (which never triggers RenderFrameDeleted), and call EnumerateChosenDirectory which uses the freed render_frame_host_ because it was never nulled out in RenderFrameDeleted.<span class="line"><!---->From there in index.html, we intercept the Mojo handle created by the renderer patch I explained above, free the render_frame_host_ (which never triggers RenderFrameDeleted), and call EnumerateChosenDirectory which uses the freed render_frame_host_ because it was never nulled out in RenderFrameDeleted.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36<!----></a><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3]           Comment 14<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1260134#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

        Yup that's the issue. My poc was using a Mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker and not the AssociatedRegistry (which is invalidated by `InvalidateMojoConnection()`. So, `broker_receiver_.reset()` after `InvalidateMojoConnection()` to prevent the poc in this issue (and any other mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker that relies on RenderFrameDeleted)<span class="line"><!---->Yup that's the issue. My poc was using a Mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker and not the AssociatedRegistry (which is invalidated by `InvalidateMojoConnection()`. So, `broker_receiver_.reset()` after `InvalidateMojoConnection()` to prevent the poc in this issue (and any other mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker that relies on RenderFrameDeleted)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by cthomp@chromium.org (Oct 14, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by cthomp@chromium.org (Oct 14, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by cthomp@chromium.org (Oct 14, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by cthomp@chromium.org (Oct 14, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      This bug is split off from <span class="line"><!---->This bug is split off from <!----></span>Issue 1260109<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260109" title="Security: [Umbrella Bug] V8 CreateLiteral type confusion when processing ..spread leads to RCE + RenderFrameHostImpl logic error leading browser UAF"><!---->Issue 1260109<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>to track the RenderFrameHostImpl bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. Note that this may be similar to <span class="line"><!---->to track the RenderFrameHostImpl bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. Note that this may be similar to <!----></span>Issue 1260007<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260007" title="Security: State tracking issue in RenderFrameHostImpl leading to UaF"><!---->Issue 1260007<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>--------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------<!----></span><br><br>= SBX: Logic error in RFHI leads to UAF<span class="line"><!---->= SBX: Logic error in RFHI leads to UAF<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></span><br>When an embedded MimeHandlerView or a Portal is created, they create an Outer and Inner WebContents with RenderFrames and RenderFrameHostImpl. The outer RenderFrameHostImpl will exist in the RenderFrame that created it. <span class="line"><!---->When an embedded MimeHandlerView or a Portal is created, they create an Outer and Inner WebContents with RenderFrames and RenderFrameHostImpl. The outer RenderFrameHostImpl will exist in the RenderFrame that created it. <!----></span><br><br>When the outer delegate receives an OnUnloadAck IPC it will reach this branch [1]<span class="line"><!---->When the outer delegate receives an OnUnloadAck IPC it will reach this branch [1]<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br> if (frame_tree_node_->render_manager()->is_attaching_inner_delegate()) {<span class="line"><!----> if (frame_tree_node_-&gt;render_manager()-&gt;is_attaching_inner_delegate()) {<!----></span><br>    RenderFrameDeleted();<span class="line"><!---->    RenderFrameDeleted();<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Which will call the WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted observer and set the RenderFrameHost's state to `RenderFrameState::kDeleting` [2]. This will cause the RenderFrameHostImpl::~RenderFrameHostImpl destructor to not fire the `RenderFrameDeleted` observer [3]. Mojo connections were are not cleared when RenderFrameDeleted is called, meaning this frame can still bind and call Mojo IPC. Opening up UAFs on every Mojo ipc object that is protected by RendererFrameDeleted [4]. For example,<span class="line"><!---->Which will call the WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted observer and set the RenderFrameHost's state to `RenderFrameState::kDeleting` [2]. This will cause the RenderFrameHostImpl::~RenderFrameHostImpl destructor to not fire the `RenderFrameDeleted` observer [3]. Mojo connections were are not cleared when RenderFrameDeleted is called, meaning this frame can still bind and call Mojo IPC. Opening up UAFs on every Mojo ipc object that is protected by RendererFrameDeleted [4]. For example,<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void InstalledAppProviderImpl::RenderFrameDeleted(<span class="line"><!---->void InstalledAppProviderImpl::RenderFrameDeleted(<!----></span><br>    RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->    RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>  if (render_frame_host_ == render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (render_frame_host_ == render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void FileSelectHelper::RenderFrameDeleted(<span class="line"><!---->void FileSelectHelper::RenderFrameDeleted(<!----></span><br>    content::RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->    content::RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>  if (render_frame_host == render_frame_host_)<span class="line"><!---->  if (render_frame_host == render_frame_host_)<!----></span><br>    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Potentially another bug: I believe that on the browser-side Portals (not renderer side) were accidentally left enabled last Novemeber after the M86 origin trial [5]. Meaning this also affects portals. If this is true (still verifying), I think this should be considered a second High severity bug as it opens up the entire portal attack surface to android.<span class="line"><!---->Potentially another bug: I believe that on the browser-side Portals (not renderer side) were accidentally left enabled last Novemeber after the M86 origin trial [5]. Meaning this also affects portals. If this is true (still verifying), I think this should be considered a second High severity bug as it opens up the entire portal attack surface to android.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span         A little more explanation on the renderer patch:<span class="line"><!---->A little more explanation on the renderer patch:<!----></span><br><br>`RenderFrameImpl::Unload` will only be called with `is_loading` set to `false` if the SwapOuterDelegateFrame is called [1], which is the case for these outer webcontent delegate frames.<span class="line"><!---->`RenderFrameImpl::Unload` will only be called with `is_loading` set to `false` if the SwapOuterDelegateFrame is called [1], which is the case for these outer webcontent delegate frames.<!----></span><br><br>The patch overwrites `RenderFrameImpl::Unload` and prevents the renderer from unloading the RenderFrameImpl in the renderer. Then it sends an OnUnloadAck to the browser to trigger `RenderFrameDeleted`. Then it executes it's own malicious javascript to bind a FileChooser which holds the render_frame_host_ that is no longer in the Created state [2].<span class="line"><!---->The patch overwrites `RenderFrameImpl::Unload` and prevents the renderer from unloading the RenderFrameImpl in the renderer. Then it sends an OnUnloadAck to the browser to trigger `RenderFrameDeleted`. Then it executes it's own malicious javascript to bind a FileChooser which holds the render_frame_host_ that is no longer in the Created state [2].<!----></span><br><br>From there in index.html, we intercept the Mojo handle created by the renderer patch I explained above, free the render_frame_host_ (which never triggers RenderFrameDeleted), and call EnumerateChosenDirectory which uses the freed render_frame_host_ because it was never nulled out in RenderFrameDeleted.<span class="line"><!---->From there in index.html, we intercept the Mojo handle created by the renderer patch I explained above, free the render_frame_host_ (which never triggers RenderFrameDeleted), and call EnumerateChosenDirectory which uses the freed render_frame_host_ because it was never nulled out in RenderFrameDeleted.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36<!----></a><br>[3]         Yup that's the issue. My poc was using a Mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker and not the AssociatedRegistry (which is invalidated by `InvalidateMojoConnection()`. So, `broker_receiver_.reset()` after `InvalidateMojoConnection()` to prevent the poc in this issue (and any other mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker that relies on RenderFrameDeleted)<span class="line"><!---->Yup that's the issue. My poc was using a Mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker and not the AssociatedRegistry (which is invalidated by `InvalidateMojoConnection()`. So, `broker_receiver_.reset()` after `InvalidateMojoConnection()` to prevent the poc in this issue (and any other mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker that relies on RenderFrameDeleted)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      This bug is split off from <span class="line"><!---->This bug is split off from <!----></span>Issue 1260109<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260109" title="Security: [Umbrella Bug] V8 CreateLiteral type confusion when processing ..spread leads to RCE + RenderFrameHostImpl logic error leading browser UAF"><!---->Issue 1260109<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>to track the RenderFrameHostImpl bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. Note that this may be similar to <span class="line"><!---->to track the RenderFrameHostImpl bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. Note that this may be similar to <!----></span>Issue 1260007<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260007" title="Security: State tracking issue in RenderFrameHostImpl leading to UaF"><!---->Issue 1260007<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>--------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------<!----></span><br><br>= SBX: Logic error in RFHI leads to UAF<span class="line"><!---->= SBX: Logic error in RFHI leads to UAF<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></span><br>When an embedded MimeHandlerView or a Portal is created, they create an Outer and Inner WebContents with RenderFrames and RenderFrameHostImpl. The outer RenderFrameHostImpl will exist in the RenderFrame that created it. <span class="line"><!---->When an embedded MimeHandlerView or a Portal is created, they create an Outer and Inner WebContents with RenderFrames and RenderFrameHostImpl. The outer RenderFrameHostImpl will exist in the RenderFrame that created it. <!----></span><br><br>When the outer delegate receives an OnUnloadAck IPC it will reach this branch [1]<span class="line"><!---->When the outer delegate receives an OnUnloadAck IPC it will reach this branch [1]<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br> if (frame_tree_node_->render_manager()->is_attaching_inner_delegate()) {<span class="line"><!----> if (frame_tree_node_-&gt;render_manager()-&gt;is_attaching_inner_delegate()) {<!----></span><br>    RenderFrameDeleted();<span class="line"><!---->    RenderFrameDeleted();<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Which will call the WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted observer and set the RenderFrameHost's state to `RenderFrameState::kDeleting` [2]. This will cause the RenderFrameHostImpl::~RenderFrameHostImpl destructor to not fire the `RenderFrameDeleted` observer [3]. Mojo connections were are not cleared when RenderFrameDeleted is called, meaning this frame can still bind and call Mojo IPC. Opening up UAFs on every Mojo ipc object that is protected by RendererFrameDeleted [4]. For example,<span class="line"><!---->Which will call the WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted observer and set the RenderFrameHost's state to `RenderFrameState::kDeleting` [2]. This will cause the RenderFrameHostImpl::~RenderFrameHostImpl destructor to not fire the `RenderFrameDeleted` observer [3]. Mojo connections were are not cleared when RenderFrameDeleted is called, meaning this frame can still bind and call Mojo IPC. Opening up UAFs on every Mojo ipc object that is protected by RendererFrameDeleted [4]. For example,<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void InstalledAppProviderImpl::RenderFrameDeleted(<span class="line"><!---->void InstalledAppProviderImpl::RenderFrameDeleted(<!----></span><br>    RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->    RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>  if (render_frame_host_ == render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (render_frame_host_ == render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void FileSelectHelper::RenderFrameDeleted(<span class="line"><!---->void FileSelectHelper::RenderFrameDeleted(<!----></span><br>    content::RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->    content::RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>  if (render_frame_host == render_frame_host_)<span class="line"><!---->  if (render_frame_host == render_frame_host_)<!----></span><br>    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Potentially another bug: I believe that on the browser-side Portals (not renderer side) were accidentally left enabled last Novemeber after the M86 origin trial [5]. Meaning this also affects portals. If this is true (still verifying), I think this should be considered a second High severity bug as it opens up the entire portal attack surface to android.<span class="line"><!---->Potentially another bug: I believe that on the browser-side Portals (not renderer side) were accidentally left enabled last Novemeber after the M86 origin trial [5]. Meaning this also affects portals. If this is true (still verifying), I think this should be considered a second High severity bug as it opens up the entire portal attack surface to android.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span Apply the renderer process patch in 18_embedder_rfhi_intercept/hack_patch.diff to 94.0.4606.81 (git reset --hard 94.0.4606.81 && gclient sync)<span class="line"><!---->1. Apply the renderer process patch in 18_embedder_rfhi_intercept/hack_patch.diff to 94.0.4606.81 (git reset --hard 94.0.4606.81 &amp;&amp; gclient sync)<!----></span><br>1a.           Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1260134#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      btiszka@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/3118852115" title="btiszka@gmail.com"><!---->btiszka@gmail.com<!----></a>
      btiszka@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->btiszka@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Fri, Oct 15, 2021, 12:55 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Oct 15, 2021, 12:55 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1260134#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Oct 15, 2021, 12:55 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1260134#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Oct 15, 2021, 12:55 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        A little more explanation on the renderer patch:<span class="line"><!---->A little more explanation on the renderer patch:<!----></span><br><br>`RenderFrameImpl::Unload` will only be called with `is_loading` set to `false` if the SwapOuterDelegateFrame is called [1], which is the case for these outer webcontent delegate frames.<span class="line"><!---->`RenderFrameImpl::Unload` will only be called with `is_loading` set to `false` if the SwapOuterDelegateFrame is called [1], which is the case for these outer webcontent delegate frames.<!----></span><br><br>The patch overwrites `RenderFrameImpl::Unload` and prevents the renderer from unloading the RenderFrameImpl in the renderer. Then it sends an OnUnloadAck to the browser to trigger `RenderFrameDeleted`. Then it executes it's own malicious javascript to bind a FileChooser which holds the render_frame_host_ that is no longer in the Created state [2].<span class="line"><!---->The patch overwrites `RenderFrameImpl::Unload` and prevents the renderer from unloading the RenderFrameImpl in the renderer. Then it sends an OnUnloadAck to the browser to trigger `RenderFrameDeleted`. Then it executes it's own malicious javascript to bind a FileChooser which holds the render_frame_host_ that is no longer in the Created state [2].<!----></span><br><br>From there in index.html, we intercept the Mojo handle created by the renderer patch I explained above, free the render_frame_host_ (which never triggers RenderFrameDeleted), and call EnumerateChosenDirectory which uses the freed render_frame_host_ because it was never nulled out in RenderFrameDeleted.<span class="line"><!---->From there in index.html, we intercept the Mojo handle created by the renderer patch I explained above, free the render_frame_host_ (which never triggers RenderFrameDeleted), and call EnumerateChosenDirectory which uses the freed render_frame_host_ because it was never nulled out in RenderFrameDeleted.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36<!----></a><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3]           Comment 14<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1260134#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

        Yup that's the issue. My poc was using a Mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker and not the AssociatedRegistry (which is invalidated by `InvalidateMojoConnection()`. So, `broker_receiver_.reset()` after `InvalidateMojoConnection()` to prevent the poc in this issue (and any other mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker that relies on RenderFrameDeleted)<span class="line"><!---->Yup that's the issue. My poc was using a Mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker and not the AssociatedRegistry (which is invalidated by `InvalidateMojoConnection()`. So, `broker_receiver_.reset()` after `InvalidateMojoConnection()` to prevent the poc in this issue (and any other mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker that relies on RenderFrameDeleted)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      This bug is split off from <span class="line"><!---->This bug is split off from <!----></span>Issue 1260109<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260109" title="Security: [Umbrella Bug] V8 CreateLiteral type confusion when processing ..spread leads to RCE + RenderFrameHostImpl logic error leading browser UAF"><!---->Issue 1260109<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>to track the RenderFrameHostImpl bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. Note that this may be similar to <span class="line"><!---->to track the RenderFrameHostImpl bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. Note that this may be similar to <!----></span>Issue 1260007<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260007" title="Security: State tracking issue in RenderFrameHostImpl leading to UaF"><!---->Issue 1260007<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>--------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------<!----></span><br><br>= SBX: Logic error in RFHI leads to UAF<span class="line"><!---->= SBX: Logic error in RFHI leads to UAF<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></span><br>When an embedded MimeHandlerView or a Portal is created, they create an Outer and Inner WebContents with RenderFrames and RenderFrameHostImpl. The outer RenderFrameHostImpl will exist in the RenderFrame that created it. <span class="line"><!---->When an embedded MimeHandlerView or a Portal is created, they create an Outer and Inner WebContents with RenderFrames and RenderFrameHostImpl. The outer RenderFrameHostImpl will exist in the RenderFrame that created it. <!----></span><br><br>When the outer delegate receives an OnUnloadAck IPC it will reach this branch [1]<span class="line"><!---->When the outer delegate receives an OnUnloadAck IPC it will reach this branch [1]<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br> if (frame_tree_node_->render_manager()->is_attaching_inner_delegate()) {<span class="line"><!----> if (frame_tree_node_-&gt;render_manager()-&gt;is_attaching_inner_delegate()) {<!----></span><br>    RenderFrameDeleted();<span class="line"><!---->    RenderFrameDeleted();<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Which will call the WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted observer and set the RenderFrameHost's state to `RenderFrameState::kDeleting` [2]. This will cause the RenderFrameHostImpl::~RenderFrameHostImpl destructor to not fire the `RenderFrameDeleted` observer [3]. Mojo connections were are not cleared when RenderFrameDeleted is called, meaning this frame can still bind and call Mojo IPC. Opening up UAFs on every Mojo ipc object that is protected by RendererFrameDeleted [4]. For example,<span class="line"><!---->Which will call the WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted observer and set the RenderFrameHost's state to `RenderFrameState::kDeleting` [2]. This will cause the RenderFrameHostImpl::~RenderFrameHostImpl destructor to not fire the `RenderFrameDeleted` observer [3]. Mojo connections were are not cleared when RenderFrameDeleted is called, meaning this frame can still bind and call Mojo IPC. Opening up UAFs on every Mojo ipc object that is protected by RendererFrameDeleted [4]. For example,<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void InstalledAppProviderImpl::RenderFrameDeleted(<span class="line"><!---->void InstalledAppProviderImpl::RenderFrameDeleted(<!----></span><br>    RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->    RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>  if (render_frame_host_ == render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (render_frame_host_ == render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void FileSelectHelper::RenderFrameDeleted(<span class="line"><!---->void FileSelectHelper::RenderFrameDeleted(<!----></span><br>    content::RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<span class="line"><!---->    content::RenderFrameHost* render_frame_host) {<!----></span><br>  if (render_frame_host == render_frame_host_)<span class="line"><!---->  if (render_frame_host == render_frame_host_)<!----></span><br>    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<span class="line"><!---->    render_frame_host_ = nullptr;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Potentially another bug: I believe that on the browser-side Portals (not renderer side) were accidentally left enabled last Novemeber after the M86 origin trial [5]. Meaning this also affects portals. If this is true (still verifying), I think this should be considered a second High severity bug as it opens up the entire portal attack surface to android.<span class="line"><!---->Potentially another bug: I believe that on the browser-side Portals (not renderer side) were accidentally left enabled last Novemeber after the M86 origin trial [5]. Meaning this also affects portals. If this is true (still verifying), I think this should be considered a second High severity bug as it opens up the entire portal attack surface to android.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span       </button>

          Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1260134#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1260134#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Oct 15, 2021, 12:55 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1260134#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Oct 15, 2021, 12:55 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        A little more explanation on the renderer patch:<span class="line"><!---->A little more explanation on the renderer patch:<!----></span><br><br>`RenderFrameImpl::Unload` will only be called with `is_loading` set to `false` if the SwapOuterDelegateFrame is called [1], which is the case for these outer webcontent delegate frames.<span class="line"><!---->`RenderFrameImpl::Unload` will only be called with `is_loading` set to `false` if the SwapOuterDelegateFrame is called [1], which is the case for these outer webcontent delegate frames.<!----></span><br><br>The patch overwrites `RenderFrameImpl::Unload` and prevents the renderer from unloading the RenderFrameImpl in the renderer. Then it sends an OnUnloadAck to the browser to trigger `RenderFrameDeleted`. Then it executes it's own malicious javascript to bind a FileChooser which holds the render_frame_host_ that is no longer in the Created state [2].<span class="line"><!---->The patch overwrites `RenderFrameImpl::Unload` and prevents the renderer from unloading the RenderFrameImpl in the renderer. Then it sends an OnUnloadAck to the browser to trigger `RenderFrameDeleted`. Then it executes it's own malicious javascript to bind a FileChooser which holds the render_frame_host_ that is no longer in the Created state [2].<!----></span><br><br>From there in index.html, we intercept the Mojo handle created by the renderer patch I explained above, free the render_frame_host_ (which never triggers RenderFrameDeleted), and call EnumerateChosenDirectory which uses the freed render_frame_host_ because it was never nulled out in RenderFrameDeleted.<span class="line"><!---->From there in index.html, we intercept the Mojo handle created by the renderer patch I explained above, free the render_frame_host_ (which never triggers RenderFrameDeleted), and call EnumerateChosenDirectory which uses the freed render_frame_host_ because it was never nulled out in RenderFrameDeleted.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=4345;drc=ed72593f177516f8a62d5c0ca19dc1f21259e71c<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=3133;drc=f0b6f7d12ea47ad7c08fb554f678c1e73801ca36<!----></a><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=1529;drc=260ee0a4e02100f735284b1abc89761d69d059ba<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=1529;drc=260ee0a4e02100f735284b1abc89761d69d059ba"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_frame_host_impl.cc;l=1529;drc=260ee0a4e02100f735284b1abc89761d69d059ba<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Yup that's the issue. My poc was using a Mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker and not the AssociatedRegistry (which is invalidated by `InvalidateMojoConnection()`. So, `broker_receiver_.reset()` after `InvalidateMojoConnection()` to prevent the poc in this issue (and any other mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker that relies on RenderFrameDeleted)<span class="line"><!---->Yup that's the issue. My poc was using a Mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker and not the AssociatedRegistry (which is invalidated by `InvalidateMojoConnection()`. So, `broker_receiver_.reset()` after `InvalidateMojoConnection()` to prevent the poc in this issue (and any other mojo binding bound to BrowserInterfaceBroker that relies on RenderFrameDeleted)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
